Chapter 38: The Great Determination to Weigh the Harm, Reproach the Slander, and Show the Evil Karma (Part 38). Having explained the great determination to weigh the merits, praise the faithful practice, and show the benefits, next, we will explain the great determination to weigh the harm, reproach the slander, and show the evil karma.
What are their characteristics?
The verse says:
It is like a mountain called Supreme Jewel Wheel,
This mountain is endowed with the seven treasures, and there is no end to them,
The poor and those seeking treasures are innumerable and boundless.
There is a jewel that can restrain treasures, called crystal peak,
If a person has this jewel, they can take the seven treasures,
Far away from the suffering of poverty, they obtain great peace and happiness;
If a person does not have this pearl, they cannot treasure it,
And all day long they cannot obtain it.
Why is this?
If a person without the pearl goes there, they only see tigers, wolves, and bears,
As well as red snakes, blue snakes, and various poisonous insects,
And never see precious treasures.
Their mind becomes extremely suspicious and frightened, and they run around in confusion,
Until they reach death.
But that person seeking treasures, due to their meager blessings and heavy offenses,
Never sees them and obtains them.
A person with very deep wholesome roots, holding the pearl of firm faith,
Enters the deep ocean of the Great Vehicle, takes the treasure of merit,
And escapes from the suffering wheel of birth and death.
Obtaining the view of the very profound treatise, due to having no true faith,
Relying on the correct, they make up wrong interpretations, and suffer in the wheel [of rebirth] without end.
It is like a person born blind, who obtains wonderful ornaments,
but has no joy or pleasure;
Although he obtains the profound treatise, because his foolishness is extreme,
He does not realize the worldly treasure, and has no mind to study and practice.
It is like a dragon dwelling in a well, who from flowing water reaches the ocean,
Because of great confusion and great disturbance, he slanders the ocean and ends his life;
Foolish people are also like this, firmly grasping what they are accustomed to,
Determining not to change, hearing the unprecedented Dharma,
Because of great confusion and great disturbance, they slander its vastness,
Falling into the evil paths, without hope of escape.
If there are any kind of sentient beings, who see and hear this treatise,
If they do not have faith and slander it, this person will then slander,
The Buddhas of the three times and all the Dharma treasures of the three times,
The ocean of monks of the three times, the sins obtained by this person,
Are immeasurable and innumerable, unable to know the limits.
The dust-like worlds in the ten directions, the buddhas and great bodhisattvas,
All appear at the same time, proclaiming such immeasurable,
Great oceans of Dharma gates, exclusively teaching and transforming this person,
Even passing through immeasurable eons, they still cannot teach and transform them.
Question: Why is it so?
Because only this Dharma is proclaimed, with no other separate paths.
The dust-like worlds in the ten directions, the buddhas and great bodhisattvas,
With the power of great spiritual penetrations, facing the distant eons of the future,
Observing their limits, there is no time for the path of enlightenment.
Question: Why is it so?
The great vajra rules, reaching the shore of great nirvana,
There is no such place.
Therefore, all practitioners, with diligent practice and skillful means, should contemplate the ocean of Dharma.
If one cannot reach its source, one will falsely give rise to a mind of slander,
Falling into the evil destinies, without any hope of escape.
One should definitely not do it, one should definitely not do it,
